description.narrative: The project raises awareness about ethical consumption and the connections between world trade and development. The project will train 30 young volunteers to be Fairtrade church ambassadors who will promote Fairtrade as a tool for global responsibility eac h in their local contexts e.g.churches. The project organises two workshops in mass events of the church: a Fairtrade producer from the global south will visit Kirkkopaivat in Turku 2017 a national event that collects 25000 church-goers and the trained amb assadors will organise a workshop in a church youth event Yhden Hinnalla in Tampere May 2018 inviting more than 2500 youngsters from around Finland. The project also compiles a toolkit that includes Fairtrade action ideas for church congregations for examp le confirmation schools. A recent study SDG:s and Fairtrade will be used in the material production as a backround information as well as action ideas from Fairtrade organisations around Europe. The project also produces a feedback card and an electronic f eedback form that makes it easy for individuals to send their feedback to a local church hoping the churches to become active ethical consumers. The project links to previous projects of Reilu kauppa ry and different church NGOs who started the Fairtrade C hurch certificate in Finland year 2007. One of the measurable goals of the project is to increase the amount of congregations applying for the status. The project also aims at deepening the participation of the existing Fairtrade churches through peer lear ning.A total of 31 600 euro grant has been given to this two-year project by MoFA.
